GameObject
Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
  GameObject.GameObject
      GameObject.MovableObject
          GameObject.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Enemy
extends MovableObject
implements java.io.Serializable

Used to represent the enemy objects present in the game. Note that there are 8 different enemy types in the game. Instead of creating 8 different classes to represent each enemy, we have a single dynamic structure that creates an enemy object based on the EnemyType passed to the constructor. Enemies can have 3 different speed attributes, the capability of passing through walls, and also 3 different levels of intelligence.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

Enemy

public Enemy(EnemyType type,
             int posX,
             int posY)
Dynamically generate the enemy object based on the EnemyType passed as argument.

Parameters:
type - EnemyType to be created
posX - x position of the enemy on the grid
posY - y position of the enemy on the grid
Method Detail

move

public void move()
This method moves the enemy based on its type of intelligence (low,medium and high).

Overrides:
move in class MovableObject

reverseDirection

public void reverseDirection()
This method reverses the direction of the enemy in terms of its cardinal direction based on the enemys' intelligence.

chasePlayer

public void chasePlayer(int playerPosX,
                        int playerPosY,
                        int distanceBetweenEnemyAndPlayer)
This method gets called if the player is close to the enemy. It is used by the enemy depending on its intelligence to chase the player, based on several parameters:

Parameters:
playerPosX - x coordinate of the player object on the grid.
playerPosY - y coordinate of the player object on the grid.
distanceBetweenEnemyAndPlayer - Distance between the center of the player object and the center of the enemy object.

death

public void death()
Disable the visibility of the object. This method gets called once the enemy has been killed by a bomb explosion.

getDirectionOfMovement

public Direction getDirectionOfMovement()
Attains the cardinal direction that the enemy is travelling towards.

Returns:
the cardinal direction of the enemy's direction of movement

setDirectionOfMovement

public void setDirectionOfMovement(Direction directionOfMovement)
Changes the cardinal direction that the enemy is travelling towards, to an assigned direction.

Parameters:
directionOfMovement - This assigned direction is now the enemy's new direction of movement.

getEnemyType

public EnemyType getEnemyType()
This method is utilised to retrieve the enemy/enemies present during game play

Returns:
the type of enemy (whether Minvo or Balloom,etc) present during each stage of game play.

getCenterOfEnemyAsCoordinate

public Coordinate getCenterOfEnemyAsCoordinate()
Retrieves the specific centered location of the enemy based on its current centeralized coordinate

Returns:
the centralized coordinate location of the enemy.

isHitByFlames

public boolean isHitByFlames()
Checks whether or not the enemy is hit by the flame

Returns:
a boolean- if enemy is hit by flame, it returns true. False if the enemy is not hit.

setHitByFlames

public void setHitByFlames(boolean hitByFlames)
Assigns whether or not the enemy is hit by the flame

Parameters:
hitByFlames - this assigned parameter is now the decision of whether or not the enemy is hit by the flame

getDifficultyRanking

public int getDifficultyRanking()
Attains the ranking of how difficult the enemy is to kill (each enemy has a different difficulty ranking)

Returns:
the integer corresponding to the enemys' difficulty ranking

getIntelligence

public ArtificialIntelligence getIntelligence()
Attains the type of intelligence the enemy contains- whether the enemy has low, medium or high intelligence

Returns:
enemys' intelligence type

getPathFinder

public PathFinder getPathFinder()
If the enemy is defined to be of high intelligence, the shortest path between the player and the enemy is defined. This method is called to attain this short path.

Returns:
the shortest path between the player and enemy

setPathFinder

public void setPathFinder(PathFinder pathFinder)
Assigns the shortest path between the player and enemy

Parameters:
pathFinder - This assigned path is now the shortest path used when the getPathFinder method is called
